author: antliakw66
title: Unexpected trip to ED cah
body: I had x2 nights unexpected stay in CAH ED. Unfortnatley it was a very very long wait. Special shout out to Jacum the medic. And phil the nurse was totally totally amazing. Staff in ED do not get the credit they deserve. Conor charge nurse has excellent leadership skills.

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust

author: Creamtea
title: Hysteroscopy
body:
Mr Bishieri and his team Carol, Sue, Amanda & Cate @ Royal Cornwall Hospital Treliske (RCHT) we’re fabulous. They all made me feel at ease all the way through and after care when finished.  
Very caring professionals who are amazing people.  
Thanks again

readBy.name: Royal Cornwall Hospitals NHS Trust

author: Reuger
title: Very uncomfortable chair
body:
I spent 8 hours in the Surgical Assessment Unit (SAU) mainly sat on a very uncomfortable chair  
Surely Dr Grays can provide beds instead of hard chairs to give patients some level of comfort I am now home with a extremely painful lower back along with my original symptoms.  
On a plus side I can’t fault the nursing care

readBy.name: NHS Grampian
Aberdeen City Health & Social Care Partnership

author: Grateful and Appreciative Mother
title: The love and care was something to behold
body: My son, who is five years old, is clinically vulnerable to covid19. We shielded with him in the early days of the pandemic and as soon as he turned five we booked an appointment at the Downshire for his vaccination. He has had his first two doses and last week had a booster. I just have to say something about the staff in the Downshire, and yet nothing I say will express how grateful I am to them or paint a true picture of how incredible they are. My son had been admitted to hospital previously, the trauma of having blood taken and multiple IV lines put in had left him with a fear of needles. We were the first people through the doors of the Downshire on the morning of his first vaccination, the staff, many of which have come out of retirement and who give up their weekends week on week, were ready and waiting for the children. They had toys and colouring in and even a little packet of sweets on hand. They chatted to my son, to me, and even to my son’s cuddly toy ‘Foxy’, they told us about their grandchildren, their experience of the pandemic, and why they do what they do. When they gave my son his first vaccination he was calm and relaxed. The second time we went it was on Valentine’s Day, the same staff, the same love and care, it was something to behold. After those first two doses we were able to relax a little, I let my son do some of the things that others take for granted and I was able to relax over his next two hospital admissions knowing that if he caught covid he was protected. He, along with the rest of the family, caught covid as soon as the school year began this year. We were all ok and I am just so grateful to those staff members who gave up their time to keep us safe. We returned last week for our boosters and the same staff were there and even remembered ‘Foxy’. This time, along with another sticker for Foxy, they gave my son a certificate and he is so proud of it, it is now on his bedroom door. Thank you to everyone who gets vaccinated, it’s been a terribly difficult couple of years and the only way things can improve is if people keep up with vaccination. That way families like ours and can join in with the rest of society, without being so horribly scared. Mostly though, thank you to the staff working in the Downshire, please know that you are appreciated and that we think you are just wonderful. Thank you.

readBy.name: South Eastern Health and Social Care Trust

author: Ellen22
title: Ward 56 Princess Royal Glasgow.
body:
Had to have a hysterectomy recently. Theatre staff and recovery staff were caring and looked after me well immediately after the surgery. As one can imagine; having the hysterectomy done and all the emotional trauma associated with this procedure was a huge deal.  
I’m a Staff Nurse myself and have been nursing for many years. Being on the receiving end of care is a totally daunting experience. Being vulnerable is scary. After receiving good care from the staff in theatre and recovery; I was transferred to ward 56 and I knew that I was in very good hands. The staff in Ward 56 were absolutely amazing. Even although I’d been through major surgery; I still had my nurse’s hat on; this made me appreciate the work and care that they were required to provide; to not just myself; but the other women in the ward even more. They were just so caring and hard working and patient.  
Special mention must go to Meghan, Hayley, Liz, Elaine, Tricia, Angela, Diane, Mary (phlebotomist) , Caitlin, Zoya (provided care to me 1st and 2nd post op - day shift. Sorry if this name is wrong). I'm in the process of recovering at home with my husband helping. Thank you all of you girls for caring for me in what was a vulnerable time for me and also for caring for the other women in the ward. Really appreciate it.

readBy.name: NHS Greater Glasgow & Clyde

author: GPC2019
title: Quiet time on the ward
body:
My child has been on the Childrens ward in the Ulster. Firstly I must commend the staff, they have all been excellent with him and very attentive to his care. We have had a positive experience during a worrying time. Unfortunately on the ward FaceTime calls (with no headphones so you can hear both sides of the conversation) hve continued well past midnight for 2/3 nights in a row and until about 930 other times. This is not helpful for sick babies. I have raised the issue with staff but I understand it’s hard for them to police also. Perhaps visuals on the ward so people of all backgrounds can understand when quiet time on the ward should be - preferably from 8/9pm.  
My husband and I have another child to look after so when we swap out we usually have her with us meaning we do a 30 second corridor swap as we didn’t think other children would be allowed on the wards. However one family had a second child with them all day from around 2-8pm who interrupted the nurses asking for juice! My child would have loved a quick hello to her brother to help her understand where he is as it is a confusing time for her but we thought best to not have her come to the ward with other sick children. We would just like rules to be the same for all the families.  
I understand this is difficult and hard for staff during their busy working days. We have been very well looked after by the staff

readBy.name: South Eastern Health and Social Care Trust

author: PauH22
title: Poor provision in A&E
body: Having returned early from holiday due to health concerns, my husband was seen by the out of hours team. They decided he needed to go to AAU, but there were no beds available, so he was sent to wait in A&E. We went to the hospital around 2am and sent to A&E an hour later. With suspected back difficulties, my husband was left to sit upright in a chair for over 15 hours, until he was blue lighted through to the spinal ward in Edinburgh with a spinal tumour. It was imperative to have him in a collar to support his neck and have him lying flat. The people working in A&E are fabulous, but the lack of provision is unacceptable. These professionals need support in being able to deliver the care the public need and deserve.

readBy.name: NHS Forth Valley
Scottish Government

author: bmc875
title: Having a pacemaker fitted
body:
After a long wait I eventually arrived at Ayr Hospital one dark October morning. I was to have a pacemaker fitted and was anxious and apprehensive. My wife accompanied me up to Station 6 where I was warmly greeted by the nursing staff and she took her leave. Half an hour later I was being operated on by a team of specialists in the OR, from Surgeon through technicians to support. A couple of hours later I was back on the ward and released later that day.  
This was a perfect example of coordinated teamwork between Ward and OR staff. I was treated with respect, dignity and care.  
I now look forward to my 6 week follow-up at Crosshouse and continuing care. As my wife said on leaving, 'They were awfy nice people!'.

readBy.name: NHS Ayrshire & Arran

author: PAtk28
title: The staff explained everything thoroughly
body:
This is the second planned visit to the RHC with our child.  
From the moment we arrived the staff were so kind, attentive and explained everything thoroughly.  
From domestic, nurses, consultant and anaesthetist the care and approach was excellent. The staff put my worried child at ease as he was anxious.  
Staff don’t get enough credit for the difficult jobs they do, we are so appreciative of the care our child received on ward 1A. Thank you ☺️  
Improvement -  
On an improvement note, signage at the waiting area of ward would be helpful as it is not clear that you don’t check in anywhere you simply wait until a nurse calls your child’s name. An explanation would be helpful to parents. Thank you

readBy.name: NHS Greater Glasgow & Clyde

author: kilocp88
title: My labour, delivery and postnatal care
body:
My partner and I went into Borders General Hospital (BGH) for a planned induction of labour for our daughter. The care we both received was incredible by the maternity staff, throughout the entire 5 days we were in.  
Although my labour and delivery did not go to plan, and after 36 hours I required an emergency C-section under general anaesthetic, me, my baby and my partner felt very safe and supported.  
I must mention my midwives, Rachel, student midwife Nicole and special mention to Joice who came on the nightshift and was present throughout our daughters’ birth and after. She made me feel safe in a time where I was terrified. She made sure my partner was able to receive our daughter out of theatre as soon as it was safe. And she was there when I came round from the anaesthetic, praising and reassuring me for the delivery of our sweet girl. I knew this lady for a few short hours and felt immense care from her and we can’t thank her enough for that.  
I should also mention Oksanna, my anaesthetist, who tried her hardest to keep me awake under epidural/spinal for my section which again did not go to plan. She did come and visit us in labour ward post op for a quick debrief and apologised for what was out of her control. She tried and that is all we could’ve asked for.  
Also Dr Faye, we can’t thank you enough for keeping me and my daughter safe during the surgery and for acting in our best interests in an impossible situation. Although labour and delivery was far from what we imagined or wished, we left with our baby and myself both safe and healthy.  
Post-natal we were well looked after in ward 16 for 3 days by Susan, Ali, Nicole, Inka and Anneka. All of which helped me establish breast feeding, encouraged me to mobilise through the post-op pain and helped with pain management and were accommodating to my partner who stayed for longer than what is probably allowed. They also answered all of our questions and gave us sound advice for caring for our newborn.  
Although things did not go to plan, we would still say our experience was overall very positive. We received the best standard of care and left with immense gratitude to all the staff involved throughout those 5 days. Thank you will never feel like enough, but we mean it sincerely from the bottom of our hearts.

readBy.name: NHS Borders
Imperial College, BSc Humanities, Philosophy & Law (2022)
Ulster University, MBBS (Medicine) 2021

author: redcq87
title: Excellent staff at the Day Surgery Unit
body: The staff were excellent, from the student who admitted me, to the anaesthetist. They were all very pleasant and kind.

readBy.name: Ulster University, MBBS (Medicine) 2021
NHS Fife
Fife Health & Social Care Partnership

author: Jazzle1949
title: Upsetting experience in A&E
body:
My dad was taken into A&E via ambulance one afternoon acutely confused. I left late in the evening and returned the following morning to what was a very distressing experience. I found my dad sitting in a chair in the middle of EAU in a gown very heavily sedated and not even able to hold his own head up and he was in fact ready to topple head first of the chair. I asked the nurse what on earth had happened and they told me they had given him medicine because he was agitated, and then turned away. I was visibly upset and in tears at how I had found my dad and the nurses around the desk all just stood and stared at me. They showed no compassion. I had phoned first thing that morning and was only told my dad had been agitated but was now asleep.  
Whilst I fully appreciate sedation may have been necessary to maintain his safety I just can’t understand why he was not put back on his trolley. What has happened to maintaining patients dignity, why was he left sitting in an area where everyone was walking past? My dad is a very quiet, gentle and proud man and he would be extremely upset at being left like this. Also not one of the members of staff tried to console me and there were plenty of them around. I had to ask for my dad to be put back on his trolley which the staff then quickly did.  
I appreciate A&E is extremely busy but let’s not forget the patients it took 2 minutes to return him to his trolley and that was much more dignified for him. Also let’s not forget the relatives in what is a very upsetting experience to see their loved ones poorly and in hospital. I hope something can be learnt from this as I would hate anyone else to experience it

readBy.name: South Eastern Health and Social Care Trust
Imperial College, BSc Humanities, Philosophy & Law (2022)

author: Lorraine c
title: Covid booster
body:
Would just like to say a huge thank you to Phil, an amazing lady who dealt with my son whom has autism! this would be his fourth time getting vaccinated by Phil  
She is very patient and talked him through everything thank you so much Phil x

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust

author: Gav12
title: Talked me through everything
body: Got my booster today a lady called Phil gave it to me she made me feel very relaxed and talked me through everything cheers Phil

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust

author: RyanL22
title: Covid autumn booster
body: Would just like to say phil the nurse who dealt with me was very kind and patient she made me feel at ease the whole time thank you Phil

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust

author: firenf76
title: Pre-Assessment Clinic Visit
body:
I visited the above clinic at the end of September 2022, and can report that I was treated with courtesy, patience and understanding.  
I was treated by Gillian (and another fine nurse) during my pre-assessment, and thankfully it all went extremely well.  
There is always a little apprehension prior to any such hospital visit, but the nurses I was involved with ensured that it all went like clockwork.  
A big 'thank-you' all round.

readBy.name: NHS Fife
Fife Health & Social Care Partnership

author: maytf65
title: Maternity care and home birth
body:
I have been cared for by the maternity team at Oban Lorn and the Isles hospital. Every person I have interacted with, from cleaners and students to midwives, physiotherapists and sonographers has been kind, helpful and knowledgeable. I have felt safe and heard throughout my care.  
I have mostly interacted with Rosie, my named midwife and couldn't thank her more for her approach. I felt supported in my desire for a home birth and was given hypobirthing lessons which I believe made this possible. Rosie listened to my concerns and desires, recommending appropriate action as required.  
I was lucky to have my home birth, with Rosie and Catherine in attendance. They made me feel safe and in control throughout. My consent was ask for, for every interaction and I had a great birth.  
I have seen a range of midwives in my postnatal care and they have all been great. I really can't thank the team more!

readBy.name: NHS Highland
Imperial College, BSc Humanities, Philosophy & Law (2022)
Office of Jenni Minto, MSP for Argyll and Bute

author: Freckles27
title: I cannot thank her enough for how she dealt with my phone call.
body: I was 7 weeks pregnant and I started to bleed. I contacted Ward 36 in October. The Nurse on the other end of the phone (unfortunately didn’t get her name) was unbelievably nice, reassuring, professional and clear that I could call back any time during the weekend. I unfortunately have miscarried however, speaking with her on that morning I knew I had help at the end of the phone if I needed it. Her manner allowed me to feel supported during this horrific experience and I cannot thank her enough for how she dealt with my phone call.

readBy.name: NHS Tayside

author: CharlieB
title: I was able to quickly make an appointment
body:
I experienced some light post menopausal bleeding and was able to quickly make an appointment to see a nurse practitioner at my GP practice. I was diagnosed with an abnormal cervix and put on the fast track referral system. I was contacted three days later by phone with an appointment at Royal Cornwall Hospital for a colposcopy at the end of that week. The receptionist making the appointment was so friendly and was able to arrange at suitable time for me to attend.  
At the hospital I was treated with care and dignity. I am an extremely nervous patient and the nursing team and my consultant were so careful and kind, explaining exactly what was happening and taking their time to get me comfortable with the procedure. Although the actual procedure was a little uncomfortable, it was over very quickly and I was reassured that things had gone well. The team were gentle, friendly, chatty and very good humoured. They made an appointment that I was very fearful about, very relaxed and professional. I would really like to thank the team for getting me through this with kindness and dignity. If I have any future appointments necessary I know that I have nothing to worry about as I was treated so kindly.

readBy.name: Royal Cornwall Hospitals NHS Trust
Imperial College, BSc Humanities, Philosophy & Law (2022)

author: Miss DMU
title: Pain Management Nurse
body:
Today I had a real 'pick me up' telephone appointment with Christine from Pain Management Team.  
I have withdrawn (Sept 2022) from a pain patch, not easy and at times awful, but with the support from Christine via telephone call or if needed email.  
Today I'm now on a open referral until December so I can contact them via email/phone if needed. I am absolutely over the moon that I am off the patch, yes I know due to my Ehlers-Danlos syndromes (EDS) etc I may need this medication again in the future & that's fine but I am at the moment in control of my pain, being able to alleviate it with pain relief.  
Christine gave me the confidence to do this as it wasn't easy but at least I had someone who listened & that I felt safe to say how things were & get answers & tips from when needed.

readBy.name: Office of Alexander Burnett, MSP for Aberdeenshire West
NHS Grampian
Imperial College, BSc Humanities, Philosophy & Law (2022)

links.id: i felt that i mattered and not just a number

title: Brilliant service
body: I recently had a tooth extraction under IV sedation as a very anxious dental patient, the 3 young ladies who carried out my procedure were professional and did there utmost best to put me at ease and talk me through the entire process. They made me feel comfortable and made what could have been a traumatic experience as pleasant as could be. Thank you for your professionalism, knowledge and for being such lovely people. For anyone else worried or anxious about procedures like this I would recommend this service.

readBy.name: Tameside and Glossop Integrated Care NHS Foundation Trust

title: excellent practice, excellent staff
body: had two appointments on the same day - physio 1st and the hypertension review with the nurse - conveniently the appointments were made so I only had a five minute wait in between.  All the doctors and staff are brilliant at the westbank practice I would recommend them 10/10

author: hadaryr34
title: Getting appointment for an urgent check up
body:
Basically, suspected case of sti and eye infection. Booked with cobridge sexual health unit and I’m going to be seen next Wednesday.  
I was very pleased as usual to get a call back confirmation and thorough questions before my booking confirmation. The only minor points is that I had to wait a bit to get through the phone lines but I guess the unit is quite busy with other patients and also perhaps to be seen almost a week later but still grateful to be seen next week.  
On the whole the service at cobridge sexual health unit is very good and I’ve been with them for more than a decade receiving a great service.  
Shame their walk in appointments and weekends ( Saturday mornings) are no longer available. It would be great to have those options again 🙂

readBy.name: Midlands Partnership NHS Foundation Trust

author: Emmgh49
authorRole: a staff member posting for a patient/service user
title: The staff have been good and the communication with them is perfect
body: I came onto 1 south last night, after I was brought from 1 west as I had just received day surgery. The staff have been good and the communication with them is perfect. The ward is just amazing, it’s very clean and I enjoy the bay I’m in as the others keep me company. The food is just okay it does the job but I wouldn’t say it’s the best.

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust

author: Emmgh49
authorRole: a staff member posting for a patient/service user
title: The staff are amazing
body: I came to the emergency department earlier in the week, I stayed down here for around 4 hours and then was given a space on the ward. The staff on 1 south are amazing the communication with the GPs is excellent, the nurses have also been providing great care to me. The food in this hospital has been lovely I have been in other hospitals before and it hasn’t been great, but here in Craigavon it’s been very nice. There is a TV in the room which is good but there was no remote, so I had to go buy a new one as I wanted to watch a few shows, I do understand that they can be easily lost so I didn’t mind buying one myself.

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust

author: Emmgh49
authorRole: a staff member posting for a patient/service user
title: I’m grateful for all that they have done
body: I came to the hospital in an ambulance, it arrived within 15 minutes and I waited in ED for around 5 hours before I went onto the ward. The staff have been great there all very lovely people and have been very caring towards me, I’m grateful for all that they have done. The ward is really clean thanks to the cleaning staff they make sure the place is spotless for all the sick patients. The food has been nice enough, it’s good the way there’s a shop in the hospital.

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust

author: Emmgh49
authorRole: a staff member posting for a patient/service user
title: The ward is really clean
body: The communication with the GPs and nurses on the ward has been great, I am always being updated about my care and they are always able to answer any questions I may have. The ward is really clean and the facilities are always cleaned over after the patients use them. The food hasn’t been nice that’s the only thing I think that needs to be updated, as it is very hard to eat and there isn’t much choice.

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust
Ulster University, MBBS (Medicine) 2021

author: Shagq75
authorRole: a staff member posting for a patient/service user
title: Male medical has good experienced staff
body:
Male medical has been okay, the noise of everything is not normal although I suppose I am in a hospital. The ward itself like the people on it are okay, they talk away to you and keep you in craic. The level of care here is quite good and I cannot complain about that.  
The staff have been very good to me, I cannot pick who has stood out as the apron is usually covering the badge. They are really good at their jobs and can tell they have plenty of experience.  
Male medical has good experienced staff.

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust

author: Shagq75
authorRole: a staff member posting for a patient/service user
title: Female medical has a good standard of care
body:
Female medical has been okay. I neither like it nor dislike it, it is a hospital and that’s that. The ward smells like disinfectant suppose it is not a bad thing although it can make your head light. The food is not great and I would rather coffee over tea but the coffee place in reception is not open every day.  
The staff are quite good I cannot say a bad word about them. They treat me well and are trying to get me better to go home.  
Female medical has a good standard of care.

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust

title: Great practice
body: Always been very kind and helpful. Never had a problem getting an appointment, might not alway be the same day if a non emergency but never a long wait or a call back from them. Great job

title: Ok getting wory
body:
It takes weeks to get a appointment
Have to phone at 8 in the morning even then no one picks up the phone my nephew who is only 6 weeks old couldn't get appointment even though they are meant to see babies under a year old

title: Total lack of planning
body: Rang to book regular, time critical injection 2 weeks ahead as normal. Told no slots until end November as nurses busy with flu and covid vaccines. No planning at all for regular, predictable known volumes alongside, or ability to prioritise actual existing needs from preventative medicine. I have repeatedly asked for recurring needs to be able to pre book the next appt at the time of attending, but "the calendars are not open, call closer to the time". I cannot drive due to injury so a walkin centre requires a taxi - thats if i can even get an appointment (walkin not an option for some services). Same situation last week when urgent blood tests (preop) required. 1st appt free was 2 weeks after surgery. And of course each contact involves an average 45 mins on hold. Today after 40 mins wait and reaching position 1 in the queue i was cut off with the message "due to system problems we cannot connect your call". It is a shame, the staff are lovely, but the practice planning is woeful.

title: Clinical Excellence
body:
At a time when the NHS is under such scrutiny and immense pressure, I feel it is essential to give an honest and accurate account of accessing GP services, as a patient at Marine Road Surgery and with the perspective of someone who has extensive experience of working in the Health and Social care Sector. 
I have been a patient at Marine Road Surgery for nearly a decade and having several complex health conditions means I have frequent and regular contact with the surgery. Non clinical practice staff are friendly and helpful, both over the phone and during face to face encounters.  I have also observed them treating people of all ages and abilities with such friendliness, patience and empathy.  
The medical care provided by Doctors, Nurse Practitioners, Nurses and Physio's can only be described as clinical excellence.  I always feel safe, cared for and that I am listened to.  I am encouraged to take part in discussions about my health and decisions about treatment and medication.  
To continue to provide effective and regular services for day to day patient visits on top of a very smooth roll out of the Covid vaccination programme and the flu jab and Covid booster jab programmes, is irrefutable proof of an exceptionally well led practice and I can say with confidence that I am in very, very good hands.

title: Super efficient
body:
I was ambulanced from Windermere on Friday last 21.  To  the ambulance crew,the porters, nurses and doctors a huge thank you

. I was the one that was attending a wedding on Saturday and everyone pulled all the stops out to get me there 
Thank you. muchos gracia

title: New Management - such an improvement!
body: I visited the Croft recently, and I have to say since it has been taken over by new management the place has really improved. The Reception Team are kind, patient and informative. Appointments seem to be more readily available, remote ones via phone too. Nice to finally have some good service and care available to us in Eastergate.

title: Caring GP
body: To the GP on duty 15-02-2022 afternoon surgery. I would like to thank him for all his effort & care he showed me.

title: Child admitted perfect service
body:
Child admitted with breathing issues whilst visiting fiends in Bradford. Excellent service across across all areas of the hospital from a&e and particularly with Staff warm and friendly updating you on a regular basis. Might be the northern hospitality but don’t believe I would have received this exceptional service in my local hospital. I know people are
Not out banging there pans at the end of there driveways now but but don’t think your service does not go unnoticed TrueType excellent service .  5 star.

title: Great Practice!
body: Every doctor I have even spoken to is kind, listens, and has explored the health concern fully. I fully recommend.

title: Life changing experience
body:
I used the Croydon Talking Therapies service for the first time. The complete positive change in my mental health has been incredible.
My therapist was extremely professional, understanding, and easy to talk to. 
The treatment I received has allowed me to have the tools to deal with issues now and on my own in the future. 
It has totally transformed how I think and has enabled me to enjoy life like I never thought possible. 
I have struggled with this issue for nearly 15 years and now I feel like a new person. I only wish I would have reached out sooner. 
I would highly recommend the service.

readBy.name: South London and Maudsley NHS Foundation Trust
Imperial College, BSc Humanities, Philosophy & Law (2022)

title: Outstanding and compassionate care
body: My 85year old dad was admitted via ambulance on the evening of his diamond wedding anniversary. He presented with a mild heart attack. The staff were absolutely fantastic being very kind, efficient and in difficult circumstances they even had time to get my mother and I a chair and a cup of coffee. I am extremely grateful for the care given to my father and he was released and able to go home and be with his beloved wife on their anniversary. Thanks Royal Devon & Exeter Hospital Staff.

readBy.name: Royal Devon University Healthcare NHS Foundation Trust (2)

title: Great practice
body:
I have been with this practice for over 5 years and found here good GPs, caring,  professional staff. Getting appointments is easy, doctors are knowledgeable and ready to help. 
Great practice

title: Covid Booster
body: I came on a Thursday evening as Charlbury Medical Centre only do the jabs in the day time no time for people that work. Your service was well organised and friendly thanks so much

title: Very well organised
body: I had the flu jab last Saturday and I was very impressed with the organisation. There were lots of volunteers and a calm atmosphere. The nurse was very efficient. Thank you

readBy.name: Healthwatch Sheffield

title: Flu Vaccination
body: It was a short easy walk to go to the Hollies for my flu vaccination. Everything was well organised and I was in and out very quickly .No waiting. It’s great to be protected against the flu for another year .

readBy.name: Healthwatch Sheffield

title: Excellent Practice
body: I have been a patient at this practice for many years and have always received the best possible support. I was recently in hospital and since being discharged have spoken to both my GP and the pharmacist about my medication. Both were very helpful and supportive which gave me a lot of confidence. I know I can contact the practice who will respond quickly which is most reassuring. I am very happy with the support I am receiving and the professionalism of the practices staff. First class well run practice in my experience which I’d have no hesitation recommending.

title: Great service & care & child friendly
body: Very grateful for the time the practice nurse took with my daughter who had to have some lung function tests. She was very kind and patient throughout which we both really appreciated- many thanks for your hard work

readBy.name: Harvey Group Practice

title: Amazing care
body:
Out of the blue whilst visiting Bath, I ended up in A&E after suffering a severe asthma attack and nearly died. The paramedic undoubtedly saved my life.
Upon arrival at hospital, the care and attention I received was nothing short of exceptional. Every single member of staff was a credit to the NHS.

readBy.name: Royal United Hospital Bath NHS Trust

title: Very well organised
body: I had the flu jab last Saturday and I was very impressed with the organisation. There were lots of volunteers and a calm atmosphere. The nurse was very efficient. Thank you

readBy.name: Healthwatch Sheffield

title: Absolutely amazing
body: I’ve only just started my therapy with IESO Health after noticing my anxiety being a lot worse than in previous years I’ve suffered. My therapist has been absolutely amazing with me, letting me talk about my worries and stresses & even after my therapy session today has outlined why I get anxiety and the feelings towards anxiety and why they may happen for myself. I cannot thank this service enough & my therapist also. I look forward to my remaining sessions and this is absolutely the first service I will look to if ever needed again in the future.

title: Great Practice
body:
It was good to be able to go to the Hollies for my annual flu jab . The arrangements were friendly efficient and well organised.
Thanks to the team for giving up your Saturday morning to protect the local community against the flu .

readBy.name: Healthwatch Sheffield

title: Child admitted perfect service
body:
Child admitted with breathing issues whilst visiting fiends in Bradford. Excellent service across across all areas of the hospital from a&e and particularly with Staff warm and friendly updating you on a regular basis. Might be the northern hospitality but don’t believe I would have received this exceptional service in my local hospital. I know people are
Not out banging there pans at the end of there driveways now but but don’t think your service does not go unnoticed TrueType excellent service .  5 star.

author: requirementzt93
authorRole: a staff member posting for a patient/service user
title: Male medical is always busy
body:
Male medical never settles, there is always something happening like a patient being moved or equipment on the go. I quite like it though it is a distraction so I do not look at the time as it can drag a bit since we cannot have visitors. The level of care is good and they pay attention to what you concerns have about.  
The staff are excellent, they explain everything to me in detail even though I am in a ward they respect that and pull the curtains when discussing sensitive matters. They try their best and you can tell that by the way they care for everyone.  
Male medical is always busy.

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust

title: Saturday appointments
body: I was pleasantly surprised that Lonsdale Medical Centre offered vaccination appointments in Saturdays. Save trying to juggle appointments with work.

author: thubankt48
title: Male medical is making sure I am getting better.
body:
Male medical has been excellent, they are trying their best to make me better. The environment is very clean and you always see cleaners here. The food is okay it is not restaurant food but it is edible.  
The staff are kind and really do their best for everyone here. Some of them can be sharp but the hours they work are just not fair, it is far too long. I feel they are over worked but what I can do?  
Male medical is making sure I am getting better.

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust

author: caringww38
title: Male medical informs me of my care.
body:
Male medical has been a life saver for me anyway. I feel myself getting better every day with all the help I am getting. The environment here is good and I feel it is a top class hospital. The food is very good and is very varied so you do not get sick of it.  
The staff are so approachable and ensure they are giving you the best care. They really are good to everyone.  
Male medical informs me of my care.

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust

title: Super service
body: Since joining Bulkington Surgery 18 months ago, we have been very happy with the services provided by the practice. However I felt I needed to leave a review to share how extremely impressed with the service I received today when I called to make an appointment on behalf of my daughter. All appointments, except emergencies, were taken. Although it wasn’t a medical emergency - the receptionist went out of her way to ensure my daughter was able to make contact with a doctor and solve the medical issue she had . It was so refreshing to deal with a cheerful person, who cares about her job and is willing to go the extra mile. If you move to the village we would highly recommend Bulkington Surgery.

title: Good
body: The service is good to us,all the members are so friendly and co-operative.the area is also good to everyone and easy to go there.

title: Great experience
body: Returned my call within a hour, listened to my concerns about my daughter and gave a prescription over the phone. Very efficient!

title: Flu jab
body: 3xcellent. No fuss, friendly staff , like a well oiled machine. It took me longer to park than have the flu jab

readBy.name: Healthwatch Sheffield

title: Amazing care and treatment
body: The paramedics who rushed me to Resus and the staff at Kings Mill provided outstanding service in my hour of need!! Despite the pressure they work under, I was given first class treatment and care which enabled me to be discharged within 6 hours of admission. This was an amazing team effort. Thank you so much.

author: septemberng49
title: Female medical has me in the loop of care.
body:
Female medical is good, I cannot really comment on much since I have not been here long. The ward can be cold but it cannot accommodate everyone. The food is decent and there is plenty of food on the plates they give and it is like a 3 course meal with starter, main course and dessert. The patients are so friendly and I like the routine that everyone respects so we can rest and sleep.  
The staff are outstanding, they are top class. They treat me with respect and I like that and listen to what I am saying. They discuss everything with me before it happens so I am in the loop of what is happening.  
Female medical has me in the loop of care.

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust

title: Very accommodating
body:
Very accommodating…
Personal and friendly and always immensely clean.
It never seems overcrowded and I never seem to wait too long for my appointment. Just feels they are on top of things which gives a great deal of confidence.

title: Fantastic inpatient maternity care
body:
I was admitted to the antenatal ward at PRH for induction of labour due to some health problems. The staff were welcoming, and explained the process and what options I had clearly. I ended up needing to stay in for several days before there was a bed available on the delivery unit, throughout this time my baby was closely monitored, and they kept me updated about the wait for a bed. 

Once a bed was available on the delivery unit, I was transferred immediately, the next steps were explained, and things moved quickly. We ended up needing some assistance with the delivery and the consultant and team who came in to help deliver our baby were fantastic. 

We then spent 36 hours on the postnatal ward where I and baby were really well looked after. I received especially fantastic support with breastfeeding, and credit being able to breastfeed successfully to the staff on the postnatal ward. 

On each ward, all the staff (midwives, student midwives, maternity support workers and doctors) introduced themselves, explained things clearly, and were both knowledgable and passionate about their job. I can't thank everyone enough for the safe arrival of our baby, and the fantastic care we both received.

author: cheetahjr96
title: Having the coil fitted
body: I felt very uneasy about having this done but the doctor and staff were very kind and made my experience a lot easier than expected

readBy.name: Midlands Partnership NHS Foundation Trust

title: Wonderful staff
body: I recently had my cataracts done at SpaMedica, I would just like to say I received the best treatment.  All the staff were pleasant, friendly and helpful.  They put me at ease and I felt looked after.  Thank you very much to all the staff, they are a credit to SpaMedica.

title: Brilliant so far!
body: My husband and I only moved to the area, and the practice, recently so have not needed much yet, but I wanted to leave a quick note of thanks for the care we've received so far - everyone in admin/on reception we've spoken to has been friendly and knowledgeable, it was straightforward to book a telephone asthma review and that review with the nurse was informative and helpful. Very pleased so far!

title: Compassionate, caring and supportive
body:
I just wanted to express my sincere thank you to you all at Meadowview Surgery for the care my family have received on numerous occasions over the last few months. 
Every time myself, my partner, or children have needed medical advice you have been so understanding, thoughtful and extremely prompt! 
As a member of NHS staff myself, I know a bad word spreads much quicker than a good one and  the past few years have been extremely challenging for us all. 

Thank you for your continued care, compassion and commitment to the health and well being of our community. It does not go unnoticed.

author: Matdw53
authorRole: a staff member posting for a patient/service user
title: Happy enough with my care
body:
The care that I have been getting so far has been pretty decent, I don’t really have any complaints about it so far.  
The doctors that I have spoken to have all been very professional however they are all incredibly kind and take the time to explain everything so well.  
The nurses I am incredibly thankful for so far they have all been incredibly kind and I am so happy with the fact they are so good and helpful always getting me everything I need.  
I can’t really complain about anything, maybe the food is a bit poor but not awful like.  
Happy enough with everything in my care has been decent

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust

title: GP appointment system for treatment not good
body: I have to stay on phone nearly an hour to book appointments as I need treatment as per my blood test. There is no single doctor available to give me or make prescriptions for my treatment and leaving message on my phone as I need treatment. However they want to start my treatment when conditions get more worse and reception lady advising me to go to urgent care? Is that possible?

author: Matdw53
authorRole: a staff member posting for a patient/service user
title: The hospital has been great
body:
The care that I have been getting in the hospital has been great so far and have been treated so well.  
I am very happy with all the staff that I have been getting treated by with everything that they have done for me. All the staff no matter what category domestics nursing doctors with every single one of them answering the questions I ask and getting me everything that we need.  
There isn’t a bad word that I could say about any part of the hospital, the facilities, the food, the staff have all give me absolutely no issues with how I have been treated

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust

author: Matdw53
authorRole: a staff member posting for a patient/service user
title: Hope for a discharge Monday
body:
The care in 1 south has been alright so far I just really hope for a discharge soon after all there is a meeting with the doctor on Monday about it.  
Speaking on the doctors who has been very nice explains everything pretty well so far and has allowed me to understand why I am in and how they are trying to get me out.  
The nurses have been absolutely great definitely no issues with anything that they have been saying to me.  
They have all been incredibly kind and no matter what I have been asking from them they helped me so much.  
I have no issues and can’t complain about anything

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust

author: Matdw53
authorRole: a staff member posting for a patient/service user
title: Not a single bad thing I could say
body: Right now I am very happy with the care that I have been getting in the hospital as it has honestly been well and truly great and there truly isn’t a single bad thing I could say about the staff that I have come into contact with. They have all been so helpful anything that I ask of them they are willing to help whether it be explaining something or a piece of toast. The explanations that I get from the doctors have all been pretty great answering all my questions. The foods alright didn’t expect anything much better so can’t really complain. I have had no issues with the care that I have been getting

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust

title: Great team and practice - thanks
body:
The whole team are clearly working hard to provide the best they can locally.
Having recently moved and transferred to Widcombe Surgery recently, interactions I've had across the team are far better than I've experienced elsewhere, from the reception team who conduct themselves with great integrity (and fit me in when there wasn't room when I had an emergency), to the clinicians who despite the time pressures put on GP surgery staff, performed a calm and complete medical support.   
Thanks to you All. I can see you dealing with frustrated and difficult patients, but you are definitely the best organised and best delivering team I have heard of, and I am very lucky and grateful.
Thank you

title: Nice Practice
body: I always find the staff friendly and easy going, and I would highly recommend this practise, always there to help.

title: Absolute lifesaver
body: Due to the frankly woeful service at my GP, i have needed to use this clinic twice in a few weeks for urgent care. The clinic is great - ample parking (unlike Whitegate Drive), clean, not too busy and as you prebook i have been in and out in 15 mins both times (unlike Whitegate drive or my GP). No idea why my GP cannot book in there, but actually it is so much quicker calling to book direct it is not worth bothering going through my GP.

title: Given wrong information again and again.
body:
I was contacted by the surgery via text a month after seeing the Gpto refer to physio. I had waited a month prior for the Gp appointment, so now 2 months on altogether. 

At the Gp appointment I asked the Gp if there was a form to fill in for physio as this had been my experience pre Covid-19. (I was seeing the physio but covid put a stop to it). The Gp said no, the surgery would refer me, nothing for me to fill in. 

I then got a text message last week on Thursday, informing me to book in with the physio at the surgery. I attended the surgery and the receptionist didn’t know what to do at all. A previous employee who was near the desk at the time told the receptionist how to put an action for the physio to give me a call when they would be in on a Tuesday. I think there’s a training issue here if someone who no longer works for the practice had to advise the receptionist! 

Today, the following Monday, I received a text message to fill in a self referral for physio. I thought this strange as I was told I would get a call on the Tuesday. I attended the surgery again. I was told the physio on a Tuesday won’t be in for a few weeks. I was given a form and told I could book an appointment online at the web address on the form. This turned out to be wholly incorrect. The form is a self referral form. There was no website to book in, as I was told. It was simply an email address to send the referral form into. So I have filled in the form and handed in at the physio post box. This is something I could have done a month ago when I asked the Gp if there was a form to fill in. This has obviously made my wait even longer than it needed to be.

I had experienced problems with the Gp back in July / August when asking for a referral to adult Adhd assessment under the Nhs right to choose. I was told it’s just depression and I’d be waiting 3 years to see someone. The Gp on the phone had never met me and was very dismissive. I asked agin for the assessment under the right to choose and I asked was there a form to fill in to send to psychiatry Uk. As I had seen this on their website. I was told there was no form and would receive something through the post.  I then waited a few weeks and phoned the surgery as I heard nothing. It took several weeks for the referral to be completed. However, my request for the right to choose was totally ignored and the referral was sent over to the Adhd team at Claire House. The wait will be around 3 months longer than if I was referred under the right to choose as I had requested. 

Last year I was in mental health crisis and the Gp would not see me, giving me new extra medication over the telephone and with no follow up ever since. I begged for a face to face appointment at the time. I was just sent a text message to refer myself for counselling. I overall feel that the level of service at the practice has really gone downhill. feel I will be looking to change surgery. Too many barriers to book appt. Not able to phone 8am

readBy.name: Imperial College, BSc Humanities, Philosophy & Law (2022)

author: Matdw53
authorRole: a staff member posting for a patient/service user
title: Left very happy with the care
body: I have been left very happy with the care that I have been getting as I have been getting treated absolutely great so far. The staff that the hospital have all been absolutely incredibly unreal, really isn’t a bad word that I could say about any of them. They have all been very kind and have been willing to help and no matter their role they always find someone who can help. The food I have actually really enjoyed too I like menu idea nice we get the choice. There really hasn’t been a problem with the care I have been getting and honestly aint got a bad word to say about it

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust

title: Impossibile to book a Gp appointment and rude…
body:
I tried to book an appointment with e-consult, but after you’ve completed the questionnaire is just telling you to call 111. I called the practice and the receptionist was so rude and was not listening at all, she was interrupting me when I was trying to explain my situation and just trying to walk away by telling to go to the website and do the e-consult again.
Absolutely rubbish practice. I’m definitely gonna change.

title: Awful practice
body: Can’t book appointments without going through doctor link or a booking suite. Told you will be contacted that day, but then you don’t hear anything. This surgery makes me lose so much faith in gp surgeries.

title: Fabulous Surgeons
body: The surgeon did a fabulous job with my eyes my senior surgeon is Distintions. For his service. The ward was also great I was on the Denton Ward & it felt like I had known everyone for years, they were all so friendly and kind and helpful. I would like to say that for me I give the Denton ward a Highly Commended. Well done all of you.

readBy.name: Norfolk and Norwich University Hospitals NHS Foundation Trust

title: Exceptional practice and care
body:
Greeted by pleasant and welcoming receptionists. Caring and efficient medical staff in all areas of examination and surgical treatments. Outstanding cleanliness (cleaners continually at work). Discharge procedures excellent; clear and precise.
It is also worth mentioning that the Solihull centre is located on an easy accessible business park where there is good parking facilities
I wish all NHS treatments were completed in a similar way.

author: Matdw53
authorRole: a staff member posting for a patient/service user
title: Staff make life so much easier
body: The staff that I have looking after me in 1 south have all been so good with the leading to my care and how I have been treated being absolutely incredible and there is not a single issue that I have had with any of them. They have all been great always having a chat and generally making being in hospital that much easier due to their empathy and understanding of the difficulties of hospital. The foods not the best to be honest I don’t really enjoy it that much but hey what can you do still not the worst food that I have tasted. I have no problems with the care get and am not gone and complain as nothing is not bad.

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust
Imperial College, BSc Humanities, Philosophy & Law (2022)

title: All staff are amazing
body:
I recently moved to Moorside Surgery after being at my previous surgery for approx 8 years and failed to diagnose me with COPD.
I joined Moorside surgery only a few months ago and already I have seen excellent Nurses and GP's.
The moment you walk into the surgery you are greeted by lovely reception staff, then seen by a fantastic Health care team.
I now have my diagnosis and on the correct treatment.  Thank you Moorside.

title: Fantastic service
body: Called Friday morning and got a call back from the duty doctor within an hour. Medication was available at my local pharmacy by lunch time. When I called again Tuesday for follow-up, I got an appointment face-to-face that same afternoon. What an incredible service, especially when primary care is under enormous pressure. Also staff on the phone were kind and efficient, they have such a tough job but do it well. Couldn't ask for more!

title: Exasperated
body: I care for both my parents who are both 86 years old. My dad has dementia and my mum various issues, one of which is a heart condition. I have been trying to book an appointment for my mum for over a month with absolutely no success whatsoever. My gp is nearly always down, or unavailable and trying to get through at 8am each morning is nearly always impossible. If and when you do get through there are never any appointments available. Why they no longer have pre-bookable appointments is beyond me??? I was told to ring 111 and maybe I could get an appointment that way, I was under the impression this was for urgent cases, maybe I'm wrong? My mums health issues are definitely getting worse and I'm at the end of my tether with the practice who certainly have no care and compassion for the patients they are supposed to serve. A number of the staff are lovely and I understand their hands are tied with all the rules and constraints they are under, but there is no need for the rudeness and sheer lack of compassion from some of the staff. I feel I have no other option than to change practices and hope for a better outcome. Get your act together managers, and an nvq in customer care is advisable for your Reception staff

author: Matdw53
authorRole: a staff member posting for a patient/service user
title: Absolutely exceptional on the ward
body: I have been left very happy with the care that I have been getting and the staff have all been treating me absolutely exceptional so far. The nursing team are all absolutely incredible like I don’t think there isn’t a bad word I could say about anything they have done. All the staff in fact from the second I first got into the ward they have all been so polite anyone new introduces themselves and what they do. Everyone so good a explaining things and making sure that I understand the whole treatment plan and what they are doing to help get me a discharge

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust

title: Flu clinic at an excellent GPs.
body:
Fast, friendly and effective flu clinic. 
I was very impressed by the speed in which I was seen. The nurse who administered my vaccination was friendly, welcoming and extremely skilled in its administration. I was in and out with minimal waiting time.  My experience at the Station Practice has always been superb, regardless of the reasons for my attendance.

author: Patient105
title: Minor Injuries was so much quieter with kind friendly staff
body:
After speaking with NHS24 and having a virtual consultation I was sent to Queen Elizabeth University Hospital (QEUH) Minor Injuries.  
I had to check in in A&E which was exceptionally busy. Minor Injuries was so much quieter with kind friendly staff, I was sent for my X-ray and on return the nurse took the time to talk it through with me. I was seen quickly and was home within 1.5hours.  
I had even brought a book to read during the wait but was unable to as everything was done so quickly. Thank you!

readBy.name: NHS 24
NHS Greater Glasgow & Clyde

author: Matdw53
authorRole: a staff member posting for a patient/service user
title: Hospital has great facilities
body: I have had absolutely no complaints about the care that I have been getting in the hospital. I have been treated really well by all the staff. The hospital has been pretty class so far great facilities and amazing staff which all of these things combined have made the care what it is and that is just great. The food that I get has actually been pretty decent sometimes, items are missing but it’s a big hospital so it could be difficult to make that much food already so the fact it is so decent is very nice. I have honestly had no issues and have been left happy enough with my care

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust

title: Brilliant mental health support - best ever!
body: Phoned reception at 8am in a severe state of mental distress. My call was answered in less than five minutes. The receptionist was simply perfect in dealing with me in my highly troubled state. I was promised a call back from a mental health nurse and was called within around an hour. The nurse was great at responding to my stressed out and confused communication and I was offered a face to face meeting within about another hour. At the meeting, the nurse was kind, relaxed, bright, understanding and helpful and I was allowed all the time I needed to talk through my issues. This has improved my mood for the day enormously and given me some positive actions to look forward to. I am so pleased I picked up the phone. A perfect and faultless service, well done and keep it up! Thank you!!!

readBy.name: Imperial College, BSc Humanities, Philosophy & Law (2022)

author: Matdw53
authorRole: a staff member posting for a patient/service user
title: Get along well with staff
body:
The care that I have been getting in the hospital this far has been very good and I believe it is so good thanks to the staff.  
I get along well within all of them as they are all incredibly polite and do a terrific job, nothing is really too much for any of them.  
The only problem with the hospital is the fact I am awaiting tests and until they get back I can’t get my transfer to the royal for planned surgery which is extremely frustrating as it delays my stay in the other side when all I really want is a discharge.  
The food has been decent and I really cannot complain about any of the care

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust

title: Excellent Practice
body: With all honestly, Someone with multiple health issues, I can testify that this Practice from reception, nurses, pharmacist to GPs were absolutely great every time I approach them, they respond to my requests and go beyond, the GPs listen with care and receptionists.. always try their best to accommodate me despite everything, I am very great full for their service and lucky to have them as Practice, wish them all well.

author: Matdw53
authorRole: a staff member posting for a patient/service user
title: Staff explain everything so well
body: The care that I have been getting in 4 south has been pretty decent and I don’t have any issues or complaints with the care that I have been getting as they have all treated me so good so far. The nurses have all been great every single one of them no matter what I ask day or night they are always more than willing to help me out and have been incredibly kind. The doctors are also pretty good always talking the time to explain stuff sand make sure I understand. The food has been great as well and honestly I am happy enough just want to get home

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust

title: Great hospital experience
body: I was warmly greeted by reception staff on arrival.  My appointment started promptly with one of the doctors, who was friendly and professional. The doctor took time to listen to me and asked relevant questions that assisted him to make a diagnosis. He also told me what the next steps were likely to be, which was helpful. I came away feeling positive and relieved as I had been given answers to long standing questions I had.  This is my first experience of visiting The Florence Nightingale Community Hospital and I can't rate it highly enough. The staff showed me care, understanding and made me feel that my reason for being there was important and that they wanted to help.

readBy.name: University Hospitals of Derby and Burton NHS Foundation Trust

title: Love the place
body: Rang up for an appointment was 19 in the queue got through in approx 10 mins was seeing the doctor an hour later

title: perfect service at spamedica sittingbourne
body: the service I received was excellent from walking in at the reception and walking out after my surgery, thank you very much

title: Beyond helpful
body: The help we have received as a family, is above and beyond. The information sharing and booking things that need to be followed up are actually completed extremely efficiently. Thank you for continuing to show empathy and care.

author: Matdw53
authorRole: a staff member posting for a patient/service user
title: Very happy with what i have seen
body: The care in the hospital has been absolutely great so far and I have had no issues with the care that I have been getting so far in the hospital. The doctors that sort out medication and treatment have been absolutely great and have been very nice towards me as thy answer any questions that I have which makes it a lot easier as if know what’s going on. I dont have a bad word to say about the nurses as they have all been absolutely incredible and always do their best to help me out. There have been no problems with my care and I am very happy with what I have seen

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust

author: Matdw53
authorRole: a staff member posting for a patient/service user
title: Missing tests causing discharge difficulties
body:
My care has been good however there have been a few frustrating moments. I was admitted a week ago for surgery which all went great. My surgeon Mr Lee was incredible through the process so kind and listened to me incredibly well, even if some other members of his team didn’t with one making me feel like they were never going to listen to me.  
But back to it so I was discharged however had to come back around a week later as I was losing a lot of blood due to blood thinners, so was given a transfusion and kept in for the night while they ran a test.  
I then was informed the test tab went missing so I redid it. This came back clear so they started to discharge me then 2 hrs later before I left they realised they got the wrong test results. So when I went back my bed had been given away because of my discharge.  
They moved me to a double side room however my head was at the sink no one could watch tv and one of the ladies has a medical condition which was very upsetting as my late husband had it. I asked to move and the incredible nurses that I have moved a bed into the hall which was so nice of them I could ask for better.  
The only other problem is the food which is all bread and things like that which is very fatty I think I just don’t like it. I am still happy with the care and appreciate it.

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust

title: Carers Support Group Meetings
body: I have been attending for a few months, met some lovely people and got heaps of support. Also have been given lots of information about activities in my area and other assistance available to me which I knew nothing about. We've had some informative speakers plus information and help from other attendees is invaluable. Excellent Group and service. Long may it continue. Thank you
